question: Will $UST be above $0.10 on May 17, 2022?
description:
This is a market on if the price of $UST (TerraUSD) will be above $0.10 in USD on May 17, 2022 (12 PM ET). 

This market will resolve to “Yes” if $UST (TerraUSD) has a candlestick closing price of $0.100001 or more, as per the resolution source, on May 17, 2022, 12 PM ET, and “No” otherwise.

The resolution source for this market will be prices listed on CoinGecko (https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/terra-usd).

This market will resolve according to the “C” (i.e. closing price) listed for the candle titled “Tue 17 May 2022, 12:00:00”, with the “Price” tab selected, in the Eastern Time Zone. Note, this 12:00:00 candle lists the opening price for 11:30:00 AM ET and the closing price for 12:00:00 PM ET. 

The check will be after the relevant candle closes. If CoinGecko is unavailable, another credible source will be chosen.

question: Will the price of a barrel of crude oil be $105 or more on May 26, 2022?
description:
This is a market on whether the price of crude oil will be at $105.00 USD or higher as of market close on May 26, 2022. If value of a barrel of oil is $105.00 or greater as of market close on the resolution date, this market will resolve as “Yes”. If the value of a barrel of oil is less than $105.00 as of market close on the resolution date, this market will resolve as “No”.

The resolution source for this market will be Yahoo Finance’s reporting of the values offered by the New York Mercantile Exchange (NYMEX), found at (https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/CL%3DF/history). Resolution will be based on the value listed in the column labelled “Close*” under the resolution date. If the resolution source is deemed unreliable, other credible media sources may be used.

question: Will ‘Top Gun: Maverick’ gross $100 million or more on the 4-day Memorial Weekend domestically?
description:
In Response to Trader Inquiry: The resolution source for this market will be the Box Office Mojo number under Domestic Weekend for the 4-day weekend, regardless of whether domestic refers to just the USA or the USA and Canada, etc.

'Top Gun: Maverick' is an upcoming American military action drama film directed by Joseph Kosinski. It is the sequel to the 1986 film, 'Top Gun'. The film stars Tom Cruise, Val Kilmer and Miles Teller. It will be released on May 27, 2022.

This is a market on how much ‘Top Gun: Maverick' will gross domestically (in the USA) on the 4-day opening weekend. The 4-day opening weekend for this market is defined as the long weekend of Friday, Saturday, Sunday and Monday (U.S. Memorial Day) after the film's release - May 27 to May 30. The “Domestic Weekend” tab on https://www.boxofficemojo.com/release/rl2500036097/ will resolve this market once the values for the 4-day weekend (May 27-30) are final (i.e. not studio estimates).

This market will resolve to "Yes" if 'Top Gun: Maverick' grossed $100,000,000 or more on the 4-day opening weekend. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

If there is no final data available by June 6, 2022, 11:59:59 PM ET, another credible source will be chosen and looked at.
groupItemTitle: $100 million or more gross on 4-day Memorial Weekend?

events.title: 'Top Gun: Maverick' - Rotten Tomatoes & Box Office
